section.name: Beigesoft™ EIS start not from scratch.
section.p: In real life a user usually starts to use an accounting software when it already has been doing its business. Assume that Bob started using Beigesoft™ EIS on 21 Jan 2016 with the same (as describing in previous articles) accounting results. He has been using single entry accounting software, he just writes records in a spreadsheet. So results are:

As you can see only Rob's wage and taxes are liabilities and Bob's income tax expenses at the same time i.e. they should be recorded as symmetric double entries. All others are recorded as single asymmetric entries. To record Inventory you should use document Item adding.
Then Bob made symmetric accounting entries "Beginning Rob's wage and taxes":
Then Bob made asymmetric accounting entries "Beginning Sales, Sales returns, COGS, Goods losses":
Then Bob made asymmetric accounting entries "Beginning Sales tax fake":
Then Bob made "Item adding" document for source "Purchase #1-1 Jan 15 2016 3:02 AM":
Then Bob made "Item adding" document for source "Manufacture # 1-2, Jan 17 2016 6:05 PM":
Then Bob made "Item adding" document for source "Manufacture # 1-1, Jan 17 2016 6:36 PM":
Then Bob made "Item adding" document for source "Purchase #1-2 Jan 17 2016 9:48 PM":
Finally Bob made "Item adding" document for source "Sales return #1-1 Jan 19 2016 10:41 AM":
Trial balances in database "from scratch" and database is almost same:
The difference 0.04USD is because of purchase return see Accounting of purchase returns, there 12 eggs was returned for 2.04USD (0.17each), but COGS entry is made for 2.00USD.
Warehouse in database "from scratch" and database "not from scratch" is the same:
Ledger in database "from scratch" and database "not from scratch" are different, e.g. Inventory:
